articles.title: Stranger Things Ends with a Big Finale
articles.summary: Stranger Things, a popular TV show, has ended after 10 years. The last episode was two hours long and was so exciting that many people tried to watch it at once, which caused Netflix's servers to have a problem for a short time. The show is set in a made-up town called Hawkins and has characters like Millie Bobby Brown. Fans watched the finale on Netflix or at special movie theaters in the US and Canada. The episode had big fights and sad moments that wrapped up the story for all the seasons. Some fans talked about mistakes in the show, like a jacket with a wrong logo. Many people had ideas about how the show would end, and some were right while others were wrong. The ending made viewers feel happy and sad as they said goodbye to the characters.

articles.title: UK Tax Rules for Cryptocurrency Users
articles.summary: In the UK, people who buy and sell cryptocurrency now have to share their account details with tax officials. This new rule started on January 1st. The tax body, called HMRC, wants to make sure everyone pays taxes on their crypto profits, like when they sell for more money than they bought. Cryptocurrency exchanges, which are like banks for crypto, must automatically give information about users to HMRC. This helps the government collect taxes that might have been missed before. Experts say many people haven't paid their crypto taxes, and these rules will make it harder to hide gains. HMRC hopes to get millions of pounds from this over the next few years. People who made money from crypto in the last year need to file a tax return by January 31st.

articles.title: Stefanos Tsitsipas Thought About Quitting Tennis
articles.summary: Stefanos Tsitsipas is a tennis player from Greece. In 2025, he had very bad back pain that made him think about stopping his tennis career. He was scared because he could not walk for two days after losing a match at the US Open. Tsitsipas has been a top player before, reaching number three in the world and playing in big finals. Now, he is ranked 36th and has only played a few matches recently. After five weeks of training without pain, he feels better and is excited to play in the United Cup and Australian Open. His goal for 2026 is to finish matches without worrying about his back. He believes he can return to his best level with hard work and care.

articles.title: Gladiator Star Changes His Name Back
articles.summary: Jamie Christian-Johal, who is called Giant on the TV show Gladiators, has decided to change his name back to Jamie Bigg. He was born as Jamie Bigg, but his name changed when he was young. Now, he wants to use his birth name again. Jamie is a big and strong person who eats a lot of food to stay fit. He is also in a play about Jack and the Beanstalk. He said he is making this change because he wants to be himself and not hide behind a character. He talked about this on social media to share his story with fans.

articles.title: A Writer's Dream Cast for a Movie About Shakespeare
articles.summary: Maggie O'Farrell wrote a book called Hamnet that tells a made-up story about William Shakespeare and his family. She also helped make a movie from her book. Maggie always wanted actor Paul Mescal to play Shakespeare in the movie because she saw him act in a play in Dublin and thought he was great. The movie is about how the death of Shakespeare's son, Hamnet, might have inspired his famous play Hamlet. It has an Irish feel with actress Jessie Buckley playing Shakespeare's wife, Agnes. Maggie joked that the director, Chlo√© Zhao, picked Irish actors without holding many auditions. Maggie grew up in Britain but visited Ireland often, which is important to her. She says there are many books about Shakespeare that people love to read.

articles.title: The Archers Celebrates 75 Years with a Special Show
articles.summary: The Archers is a radio show that started in 1951 and is now 75 years old. To celebrate, the actors recreated the first scene from the very first episode because the original recording was lost. This special event was part of a day of fun programs on Radio 4. The show is recorded in Birmingham and is the longest-running radio soap opera in the world. Even though it's old, many young people like it too. A 45-minute special called The Archers: Truth and Lies will play on New Year's Day, and a new podcast will air. The actors played characters like Dan and Doris Archer in the recreated scene, which you can watch online or listen to on social media. The editor said the show has timeless appeal and attracts new listeners, making it special for everyone.
